projects.title: Nota
projects.description:
Created out of my frustration to manually create invoices for clients while working on my high-school web company Aerix:

- It's manual work and I don't believe in doing bulk manual work which drains the soul and my productive time when it can be automated
- Errors in filling them in (forgetting items, mistakes in price calculations) are extremely embarrassing/unprofessional
- Existing solutions were not user-friendly and produced unprofessional looking results

Nota receives some JSON data as input and outputs a beautifully typeset and layout PDF as output. Template can be created with HTML+CSS+any JS framework of choice. Can be called from CLI or exposed as web interface.

Coincidentally I also created a template which was practically a LaTeX replacement by combing the ComputerModern typeface and the Khan Academy KaTeX renderer. I used this a lot during my studies to create document that were virtually indistinguishable from LaTeX, but in contrast to LaTeX were a delight to write.

profile_positions.description:
FeedbackFruits is a scale-up with the ambition to accelerate a transition in education; from rote-memorization to 21st century skills like critical thinking. Our long-term vision is cultivating the next generation of emphatic critical thinkers. A generation of citizens equipped with all the mental tools that allow them to tackle today's pressing civil and political problems:

From fake-news, political bubbles, polarization and political outrage: the faith in shared objective truth is in decay. Conspiracies feed on a growing distrust in authorities. Science is often reduced to just another opinion. With every enraging tweet or polarizing clickbait-news, we're taking out a debt on the social fabric of society, by bankrupting our democratic functioning bit by bit. The modern attention economy benefits greatly from the short term exploitation of our gullibility and persuadability. But the long term damaging effects are externalized on society, leaving us to pay for repairing social trust and understanding in the future. While awareness of the growing debt is dawning, we discover it has also left us still needing to figure how to repay this at scale; how do we depolarize?

I believe we must learn to resist, for example by choosing which media sources (read truth sources) we trust more carefully and critically, and cultivating mental immunity against the spread of conspiracy, sensation, myths and the sowing of social distrust.

To solve this classic tragedy of the commons, it's my core belief that the true long-term solution - not fighting some symptom - has to lie at the root of where we're supposed to learn to think: education!

I got involved shortly after founding. Initially responsible for engineering and programming, I expanded more roles to design, visuals and communication. Recently I've pivoted my role to towards post-truth politics themes, ethics and pedagogy.

Any ideas? Hit me up for a cup of coffee and a chat!
